DataElement.preferredName: Exon Microarray Reporter Probe Region Identifier java.lang.Long
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.:A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Also refers to any substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.:A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Also refers to any substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved.

Concepts.definition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.

A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.

A biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. Also refers to any substance that is identifiable by virtue of its radioactive signature, color, or other distinguishing physical property, such as a dye, radioactive isotope, or inert chemical, that is introduced into a biological or mechanical system and can be followed through the course of a process, providing information on the pattern of events in the process or on the redistribution of the parts, elements, or events involved.

Property.preferredDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/2/11 - Released as part of caArray v2.4 model cleanup.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
